name: Wee Glory - Pattern Q105 PDF pattern
description:
$5.00

Pattern - #Q105
Finished size 10¾” x 14”

Such a cute little table topper, mini quilt or, as shown in the picture, this little flag is the perfect size to hang on a small garden flag holder.  Super fast, can be made in a few hours, even for beginners. Great project to use your scraps!

Materials Needed (based on 44"-45" wide fabric) 
* Blue Fabric – 10-inch square
* Beige Fabric – 9” x 18” (fat eighth)
* Red Fabric – 18” x 22” (fat quarter)
* Binding – 1/6 yard (42” wide)
* Batting – 12” x 16”

---------------------------------------

**PDF patterns will be emailed to you usually within 24 hours, and paper patterns will be shipped via USPS.**

name: Fat Quarter Table Runner VII - Pattern Q117 PAPER pattern
description:
15" x 42" Table Runner
Pattern #Q117

This is one of a complete series of patterns, each featuring the same sewing style, as well as the same material requirements. If you purchased a kit in a store for one of these patterns, it is  completely interchangeable between all the Fat Quarter Table Runner patterns!

Instructions include strip piecing, quilt-as-you-sew assembly, and in just a few hours you will be able to decorate your table with this easy to make pieced table runner.

Materials Needed (based on 44"-45" wide fabric)
* 4 fat quarters
* 2/3 yard backing fabric
* Batting 24" x 45"
* 1/4 yard binding

---------------------------------------

**PDF patterns will be emailed to you usually within 24 hours, and paper patterns will be shipped via USPS.**

name: Fat Quarter Table Runner III - Pattern Q112 PAPER pattern
description:
15" x 40" Table Runner
Pattern #Q112

Third in the series! Four fat quarters, strip piecing and quilt-as-you-sew assembly, make this runner stitch together in no time! Quick for the experienced, but simple enough for beginners. Emphasize the braid down the center or play up the hearts along the border.

Kits purchased at a store or online are interchangeable between all the Fat Quarter Table Runner patterns. In just a few hours you will be able to decorate your table with this easy to make project.

Materials Needed (based on 44"-45" wide fabric)
* 4 fat quarters
* 2/3 yard backing fabric
* Batting 24" x 45"
* 1/4 yard binding

**PDF patterns will be emailed to you usually within 24 hours, and paper patterns will be shipped via USPS.**

name: Jelly Roll Runners and More I - Pattern Q115 PAPER Pattern
description:
Pattern #Q115

Jelly Roll Runners and More I are just that - lots more! It only takes one jelly roll to complete four projects, using strip piecing and quilt-as-you-sew assembly. These are fat quarter friendly, too!

There are 12 included layout designs to choose from. Choose the four you wish to make, then begin assembly to complete those four projects.

Finished sizes include:
* The Long of It (table runner on wall): 12-1/2" x 48-1/2"
* The Short of It (wall hanging on wall) 24-1/2" square
* Just Right (table runner hanging on chair) 16-1/2" x 36-1/2"

---------------------------------------

**PDF patterns will be emailed to you usually within 24 hours, and paper patterns will be shipped via USPS.**

name: Boot Roundup - Pattern Q109 PAPER Pattern
description:
67-1/2" x 94" Quilt
Pattern #Q109

Pull up your boot straps and get ready to sew, 'cause this quilt is gonna take you for an easy, two-steppin' time! Get perfect precision from paper-pieced boots, with concise cutting instructions to streamline your construction time. 

Twin-size directions make this a must for some little cowboy's bed, but this can easily be down-sized to a wall-hanging or even a tablerunner for the bigger cowpoke in your life. Simple sashing and two easy borders complete the quilt. 

---------------------------------------

**PDF patterns will be emailed to you usually within 24 hours, and paper patterns will be shipped via USPS.**

name: Winter Welcome - Pattern Q104 PAPER pattern
description:
44" x 56" Quilt
18" x 18" Wall Hanging
6" x 16" Pillow
Pattern #Q104

You can almost feel Jack Frost nipping at your nose as Winter Welcome gleefully parades snowmen, mittens, caps & gloves across a quilt spiraling with pinwheels! Measuring 44" x 56", this quilt is great for using up your scraps for pieced blocks & simple fusible applique pieces. There are lots of cute embellishments - from snaps & buttons to embroidery & yo-yos - it's all here! 

Pattern includes instructions for matching wall hanging and fringed pillow.
 
---------------------------------------

**PDF patterns will be emailed to you usually within 24 hours, and paper patterns will be shipped via USPS.**

name: Catch of the Day - Pattern Q103 PAPER Pattern
description:
48" x 48" Quilt 
Pattern Q103

Remember that special focus fabric you bought but couldn't bear to cut? Catch of the Day is the perfect design for showcasing that lovely fabric in a quick & easy project. It can be made with as few as four fabrics & goes together quickly with simple instructions & easy piecing.
 
---------------------------------------

**PDF patterns will be emailed to you usually within 24 hours, and paper patterns will be shipped via USPS.**

name: Raggedy Pine - Pattern Q101 PAPER Pattern
description:
Pattern #Q101
50" x 54" quilt

Raggedy Pine is a simple, strip-pieced, no-fuss rag quilt which can be left plain for a "lodge" look or embellished with raggedy garland (instructions included with pattern), buttons and more to create the perfect Christmas tree. This is perfect for those with small living spaces, such as a dorm room, nursing home or apartment. Just hang on the wall and stack the presents beneath!

Materials Needed (based on 44"-45" wide fabric)
* Background (beige) fabric
       5 assorted 1/2-yard cuts
       1 additional 1-yd cut 
* Tree (green) fabric
       3 assorted 1/2-yard cuts
       1 additional 1/4-yard cut
* Tree trunk (brown) fabric
       1 fat quarter
* Border and garland (red) fabric
       2 yards
* ornerstones and star (gold fabric)
       1/2-yard
Twin-size cotton batting 
 
---------------------------------------

**PDF patterns will be emailed to you usually within 24 hours, and paper patterns will be shipped via USPS.**
